__e: I'm sorry, Herr Kommandant, but my son, My son has died.
Well, Herr Kommandant, I think if a man...
Well, Herr Kommandant, I should say almost all are here.
He's in his office, Herr Major.
She seems of great interest to you, Major.
Herr Major, if my word means anything I can vouch for everything the young captain has just said.
That is exactly what I was thinking, Herr General.
Oh, Herr General, don't I always do a good job for you?
If it could be done, it should be done by you, mein Herr general.
Now that you're absent, the Party lacks leadership.
Well, that, my dear Herr Hitler... is a question you must ask yourself... when you wrestle with the true identity, you know.
Alternatively, we could drink tea, clear our throats a lot and have a long conversation about the weather while we wait for Herr Hitler.
